data.title: Ari Up
data.meta_description: As the flamboyant lead singer with the Slits, Ari Up cut a memorable figure on the late 1970s punk scene. While so many punk singers — including John Lydon, who was to become her stepfather — worked
data.text:
As the flamboyant lead singer with the Slits, Ari Up cut a memorable figure on the late 1970s punk scene. While so many punk singers — including John Lydon, who was to become her stepfather — worked hard to effect a snarl of alienation and anger, Ari Up’s trademark was to sound wickedly mischievous as she warbled engagingly off key. Still in her early teens when she formed the Slits, the effect was punk rock meets St Trinian’s and even when she adopted the stridently ranting vocal style of her punk peers, she could not help but sound as if her tongue was firmly in her cheek.

This sense of playfulness was equally evident on the cover of their first album, which featured the group’s
